column4: Emily finds a book she really wants to read in the library, but discovers the book is already borrowed by someone else. Emily sees a book with a similar cover next to it, thinks it is the same book, and takes it away. When she gets home, Emily realizes it is a different book, but she is too lazy to return it. At the same time, Kate is busy working in the library. She knows this book belongs to a blind person who is waiting for this book. Kate gets tricked by a blind person she doesn't know not long ago, she notices Emily takes the wrong book, but she chooses not to tell Emily.
column7: What kind of emotion does Emily feel after she realizes she takes the wrong book and decides not to return it?
column8: Emily possibly feels indifferent, because she finds a book she wants to read, and she doesn't want to bother herself to go back and return the book.
column9: Emily possibly feels frustrated, because she can't read the book she originally wants to read.
column10: Emily possibly feels guilty and uneasy, because she knows she takes the wrong book, but she doesn't want to take the trouble to return it.
column11: Emily possibly feels satisfied, because she thinks she accidentally finds a new book, and considers this as a kind of luck.

column7: Kate knows Emily takes the wrong book, but she chooses not to tell Emily, what kind of emotion does she feel?
column8: Kate possibly thinks that by not intervening, she introspects and punishes herself for her past experiences in some way.
column9: Kate has a disgust for the blind, even if she knows Emily takes the wrong book, she chooses not to tell her.
column10: Kate possibly feels guilty and conflicted, because she knows she should tell Emily, but she chooses not to.
column11: Kate possibly does not care about this situation, thinks it is not her responsibility.

column4: James shows his painting at the school art exhibition. One day, he forgets to take the painting home. Nick, while cleaning the exhibition room, mistakes the painting for abandoned and puts it in the discard box. Meanwhile, Ella knows this is James's work. Ella's own painting also shows at the art exhibition, and she does not want James's painting to be more popular than hers, so she decides not to tell Nick. When James finds the painting is missing, he feels very upset and starts asking classmates. Later, Nick realizes he may have mishandled James's painting.
column7: What kind of emotion does Nick feel after realizing he may have mishandled James's painting?
column8: Nick possibly feels satisfied because he completes the task of cleaning the exhibition room, helping to clear useless items.
column9: Nick possibly feels indifferent, and he indeed does not know at the time, nor does he intentionally take James's.
column10: Nick possibly feels guilty and anxious because he unintentionally causes loss to others.
column11: Nick possibly feels confused because he is not sure if he really handles James's painting.

column9: Ella possibly feels worried, fearing that James finds out she knows the truth but does not tell Nick.

column4: Li Lei forgets his laptop in the library. Han Meimei volunteers at the library, finds this computer, but thinks it is a donated old computer, so she puts it in the donation box. Li Hua sees it, he knows this is Li Lei's computer, but he is always the second in the class, always falls behind Li Lei by one place, he thinks that as long as Li Lei does not have a computer, he cannot review his homework, deliberately does not tell Han Meimei the truth. When Li Lei comes back to look for the computer, he still does not find the computer, he feels very anxious and lost. Han Meimei only knows that she has mishandled Li Lei's laptop when Li Lei asks her.
column7: What kind of emotion does Han Meimei possibly feel after she knows that she has mishandled Li Lei's laptop?
column8: Han Meimei possibly feels proud and satisfied, because she thinks she is helping the library handle donated items.
column9: Han Meimei possibly feels indifferent, because handling donated items is part of her daily work.
column10: Han Meimei possibly thinks that putting the computer in the donation box is the right action, so she feels happy and relieved even if she knows the truth.
column11: Han Meimei realizes that her mistake possibly causes trouble for Li Lei, so she possibly feels guilty.
